TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ChartImageWrapMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the drawing mode for a background image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ChartImageWrapMode enumeration represents the drawing mode for a background image, as set by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control. To set a background image for a chart element, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImage%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > If you specify the Unscaled value, the location where the image is drawn will depend on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageAlignment%2A> property setting.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode Scaled = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Background image is scaled to fit the entire chart element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode Tile = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Background image is tiled to fit the entire chart element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode TileFlipX = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Every other tiled image is reversed around the X-axis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode TileFlipXY = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Every other tiled image is reversed around the X-axis and Y-axis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode TileFlipY = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Every other tiled image is reversed around the Y-axis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode Unscaled = int32(100)
